pullRequest.body:
This PR constructs the additive group structure on `AddChar A G` (a copy of its multiplicative group structure) and leverages it to define the double dual embedding as a morphism `A â†’+ AddChar (AddChar A M) M`.

From LeanAPAP

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f4a6ce320b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15441/commits/f4a6ce320b56cab79ab957815e22222f8ca49522)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_apply`
`+ coe_add`
`+ coe_nsmul`
`+ coe_prod`
`+ coe_sum`
`+ coe_zero`
`+ div_apply`
`+ div_apply'`
`+ doubleDualEmb`
`+ doubleDualEmb_apply`
`+ eq_zero_iff`
`+ instAddCommMonoid`
`+ instZero`
`+ instance : AddCommGroup (AddChar A M) := Additive.addCommGroup`
`+ mul_eq_add`
`+ ne_zero_iff`
`+ neg_apply`
`+ neg_apply'`
`+ nsmul_apply`
`+ one_eq_zero`
`+ pow_eq_nsmul`
`+ prod_apply`
`+ prod_eq_sum`
`+ sub_apply`
`+ sub_apply'`
`+ sum_apply`
`+ sum_eq_ite`
`+ sum_eq_zero_iff_ne_zero`
`+ sum_ne_zero_iff_eq_zero`
`+ zero_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I understand the issue you're facing here, but I am not terribly happy with the proposed solution: having a structure with "addition" and "multiplication" operations which are actually two different names for the same operation seems confusing and I fear it would be awkward to maintain.

Have you considered the alternative of defining the dual of `G` in purely additive language, as `G â†’+ UnitAddCircle`? Then you never step outside the additive world, and the definition of the double-dual embedding is completely transparent.

> Have you considered the alternative of defining the dual of `G` in purely additive language, as `G â†’+ UnitAddCircle`?

Yes, and it has the following problem: I can't directly apply `f : G â†’+ UnitAddCircle` at `a : G` to get `f a : â„‚` (or `dft f : (G â†’+ UnitAddCircle) â†’+ UnitAddCircle` at `g : G â†’+ UnitAddCircle` to get `dft f g : â„‚`). This is problematic since I am manipulating big complex-valued expressions obtained from evaluating such functions.

> > Have you considered the alternative of defining the dual of `G` in purely additive language, as `G â†’+ UnitAddCircle`?
> 
> Yes, and it has the following problem: I can't directly apply `f : G â†’+ UnitAddCircle` at `a : G` to get `f a : â„‚`

`(f a).toCircle`? Or you can define a local notation for `UnitAddCircle.toCircle` (or the bundled version `toCircle_addChar`) and shorten things further (analogous to the use of `ðž` in the Fourier-transform theory over the reals).

> (or `dft f : (G â†’+ UnitAddCircle) â†’+ UnitAddCircle` at `g : G â†’+ UnitAddCircle` to get `dft f g : â„‚`

I don't think you mean this, because `dft f` won't take values in any kind of circle. But if we let `ðž` be notation for `UnitAddCircle.toCircle`, you can define `dft f` to be the function sending `h : G â†’+ UnitAddCircle` to `âˆ‘ g : G, ðž (h g) â€¢ f g`, with optional signs and/or factors of `G.card` according to taste.

I don't think those extra characters everywhere are counterbalancing not needing a one-time duplication of a small part of the API.

I have built all of APAP on this design choice after [this discussion on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Additive.20characters), in particular [this message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Additive.20characters/near/378870289) by @MichaelStollBayreuth who agreed with having both notations.
Fair enough; if the alternatives are worse, then we can probably live with the duplication of additive / multiplicative structures.

> who agreed with having both notations

My point was that apparently both notations are commonly used (in different parts of mathematics), so it makes sense for Mathlib to support both.

LGTM.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10678081130/job/29594439346)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10678081130/job/29594440228)
bors d+
bors d+

```suggestion
/-- When `M` is commutative, `AddChar A M` is an additive commutative monoid. -/
instance instAddCommMonoid : AddCommMonoid (AddChar A M) := Additive.addCommMonoid
```
For reasons of symmetry?

```suggestion
We simply define both the additive and multiplicative group structures and prove them equal.

For more information on this design decision, see the following zulip thread:
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Additive.20characters
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AddChar): Additive group structure and double dual embedding
